comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: There are lots of materials and articles on this platform prepared by reputable members well known to be of good contributions to this platform. They are very good at their field of experience and expertise. If you can take out time to read through their materials, I believe you will have more knowledge about Bitcoin and additional information about what you are looking for here on this platform. You can see for yourself Ratimov has a good work on this which many have shared their testimonials about it and how helpful it is to their learning about Bitcoin as a whole.  You can see the thread here and it is constantly updated on monthly basis for further information to be included. You are free to read and learn from others as well as it is a combination of different works compiled together for reading.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: raybucks on October 09, 2023, 10:17:07 AMsharing here so newbie can know about it. because I was not found as a newbie than.Are you just looking for a website where you can learn about bitcoin or do you need any educational materials that can help your journey to bitcoin education? If you need those materials, then I will advise you to check out: 1.  [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why? 2.  [General] How to earn Bitcoins  I believe this might be helpful to you as well if you can devote your time to reading them, as they cover important things that you really need to learn, such as what could be considered a wallet, security procedures, how to be safe, and how to set up a wallet. Many of the questions that you might think of asking might already have existing material about them where it's explained in detail. Good luck with your research work, and I hope this becomes helpful to you.

comments.author: Winterfrost
comments.body: This is a good resources you have shared here. I found it helpful especially to newbies. But one thing a certain of is that the knowledge of Bitcoin is not on one particular website or video alone.  For a better understanding of Bitcoin it is the best if you diversify your learning resources and look our for more information's that will help you a lot. When i started learning about Bitcoin I watched a lot of videos and downloaded online courses personally.Also, the website doesn't seems to be that user friendly, I noticed that its not responsive for some other devices. It will best if the owner of the site make some changes o the color and the distracting night rocket gif there. I feel its unnecessary and some content should be made like a pdf so anyone can download it and read them without getting to open the site every time they want to learn.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: It is a site that includes a list of good BitcoinTalk topics that may be useful to anyone who has good background about bitcoin and wants to increase it. If you want to benefit from this forum better, use the search feature. This thread explains searching effectively https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0The threads on the https://www.n0nce.eu/ website are not directed to beginners who do not have any knowledge about Bitcoin, but rather a personal list of threads that n0nce finds useful.Quote from: Nwada001 on October 09, 2023, 12:58:34 PM1.  [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why? 2. comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on October 09, 2023, 02:03:07 PMQuote from: Nwada001 on October 09, 2023, 12:58:34 PM1.  [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why? 2.  [General] How to earn Bitcoins These topics are from the year 2016, and many changes have occurred since that date, so I do not think they are appropriate.The topic was 2016, but the last update for the first topic was in September 2020, followed by the second one in May of that same year, and I believe the reason why the OP has not updated it is because he has left the forum for good. The time for the information might appear to be old, but there has been a recent update that has been added to it, and for the record, no information is a waste; the time frame in which it was published does not really matter. What matters is what you can learn from it, and as a researcher, when you come across something you are not too convinced about, what you have to do is DYOR. Just as there have been some changes in aspects of wallet recommendations when it comes to those who have updated their features and added things that might be considered dangerous to users, it's important to always run a little research yourself before adding to the information you have in your table.
